中文标题: 西锐公司由于发动机问题停飞SR22和SR22T飞机
整编内容:
单发飞机制造商西锐飞机公司在发现大陆航空航天公司的活塞发动机存在“问题”后，停飞其SR22和SR22T飞机，这两型飞机都以大陆公司的活塞发动机为动力。
停飞只针对西锐拥有和运营的飞机，公司正在确定问题的范围和受影响飞机的具体序列号范围。但出于谨慎，西锐决定暂时停飞2021年6月1日至2023年2月7日制造的SR22和SR22T飞机。公司没有说明这将影响多少架飞机，但根据数据分析公司Cirium 的机队数据，停飞涉及到700架飞机，这些飞机目前正在世界各地飞行。
美国FAA表示，正在“调查这个问题，并评估可能的下一步措施”。
西锐公司表示，将继续运营其所有的SR20，以及2021年6月1日之前或2023年2月7日之后制造的SR22和sr22T。公司大陆公司不久就会发布服务公告，详细说明受影响飞机的具体范围、问题的根本原因以及纠正措施。 
2022年7月，FAA发布了一项全面指令，以解决一个长期存在的尾气排放问题，该问题可能影响4.1万架在美国注册的飞机，包括一些西锐公司的型号。FAA要求运营商更换涡轮增压发动机中的“v型联轴器”，因为Cirium联轴器上的“点焊”容易出现疲劳故障。该v型联轴器将“排气尾管连接到涡轮增压器排气口”。
整编机构: 中国航空发动机研究院
源标题: Cirrus grounds its own SR22 and SR22T aircraft due to engine ‘issue’
原文:
Cirrus Aircraft, maker of high-performance single-engine aircraft, has grounded its SR22 and SR22T models after “an issue” was discovered with its Continental Aerospace engines.
The grounding is for Cirrus-owned and operated aircraft only, but was revealed in an email to all of the types’ owners on 8 February.
“Cirrus Aircraft has been informed by Continental…of an issue that affects engines that power both Cirrus Aircraft’s SR22 and SR22T models,” the company says in the email.
“While we are still working with Continental to determine the scope of the issue and the specific serial number range of affected aircraft, we are pro-actively making the decision – out of an abundance of caution – to pause all internal Cirrus Aircraft company flight operations on SR22 and SR22Ts manufactured and issued a Certificate of Airworthiness from June 1, 2021, through February 7, 2023,” Cirrus adds.
The company did not say how how many aircraft this affects, but according to Cirium fleets data up to 700 of the two types certified during the specified time frame could be flying around the world.
The Federal Aviation Administration says it is ”investigating the issue and is evaluating possible next steps”.
“Continental is pro-actively working with the FAA as a standard protocol for a situation of this nature,” Cirrus adds. “We are unaware if the FAA will choose to issue an AD for this issue.”
Duluth-based Cirrus says that it continues to operate all its SR20s, as well as SR22s and SR22Ts manufactured before June 1, 2021 or after February 7, 2023, without restrictions.
“We anticipate Continental to issue a Service Bulletin in the near future, which will detail the specific range of affected aircraft, the root cause of the issue and corrective action,” the company says. “The Continental Service Bulletin will accompany a Cirrus Aircraft Service Advisory notification.”
Last July, the US regulator issued a sweeping directive to address a long-standing tailpipe problem potentially affecting 41,000 US-registered aircraft with turbocharged reciprocating engines, including some Cirrus models.
The AD required operators to replace “v-band couplings” in turbocharged engines because “spot welds” on those couplings were subject to fatigue failure. V-band couplings attach “the exhaust tailpipe to the turbocharger exhaust outlet”, the FAA said.
中文原文: 高性能单引擎飞机制造商卷云飞机在发现其大陆航空发动机“问题”后，停飞了其SR22和SR22T型号。停飞只针对卷云拥有和运营的飞机，但在2月8日给所有类型所有者的电子邮件中透露。该公司在电子邮件中说：“卷云飞机已经被大陆公司……告知一个问题，这个问题影响了卷云飞机的SR22和SR22T型号的发动机。”“虽然我们仍在与大陆航空公司合作，以确定问题的范围和受影响飞机的具体序列号范围，但我们出于高度谨慎，积极做出决定--从2021年6月1日至2023年2月7日，暂停卷云飞机公司在制造并颁发适航证书的SR22和SR22Ts上的所有内部飞行作业，”卷云补充说。该公司没有透露这会影响多少架飞机，但根据Cirium fleets的数据，在指定的时间框架内认证的两种类型中，多达700架可能在世界各地飞行。联邦航空管理局表示，它正在“调查这个问题，并评估可能的下一步措施”。“大陆航空公司正在积极与美国联邦航空局合作，作为这种性质情况的标准协议，”西鲁斯补充说。“我们不知道美国联邦航空局是否会选择为此问题发布广告。”总部位于德卢斯的卷云表示，它继续不受限制地运营其所有SR20，以及2021年6月1日前或2023年2月7日后制造的SR22和SR22T。该公司表示：“我们预计大陆航空公司将在不久的将来发布一份服务公告，详细说明受影响飞机的具体范围、问题的根本原因和纠正措施。”“大陆服务公告将伴随着卷云飞机服务咨询通知.”去年7月，美国监管机构发布了一项全面的指令，以解决一个长期存在的尾管问题，该问题可能影响4.1万架美国注册的涡轮增压往复式发动机飞机，包括一些卷云机型。该广告要求运营商更换涡轮增压发动机中的“v波段联轴器”，因为这些联轴器上的“点焊”容易疲劳失效。美国联邦航空局表示，V带联轴器将“排气尾管连接到涡轮增压器排气出口”。

源标题: Raksha Mantri lays foundation stone for Defence Technology & Test Centre and BRAHMOS Manufacturing Centre of DRDO in Lucknow
原文:
Exudes confidence that they will play a pivotal role in bolstering national security, defence production & economy
The units will generate revenue, provide employment opportunities to the youth & help in achieving ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat’: RM
26 DECEMBER 2021
Raksha Mantri Shri Rajnath Singh laid the foundation stone for Defence Technology & Test Centre and BRAHMOS Manufacturing Centre, established by Defence Research & Development Organisation (DRDO) in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh on December 26, 2021. The foundation for the two units was laid in the presence of Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Shri Yogi Adityanath. A first of its kind Defence Technologies & Test Centre (DTTC), over approximately 22 acres is being set up to accelerate the growth of the defence and aerospace manufacturing clusters in Uttar Pradesh Defence Industrial Corridor (UP DIC). It will consist of the following six subcentres:
1. Deep-Tech Innovation & Startup Incubation Centre
2. Design & Simulation Centre
3. Testing & Evaluation Centre
4. Centre for Industry 4.0/Digital Manufacturing
5. Skill Development Centre
6. Business Development Centre
The BRAHMOS Manufacturing Centre, announced by BrahMos Aerospace, is a modern, state-of-art facility in the Lucknow node of UP DIC. It will cover over 200 acres and produce the new BRAHMOS-NG (Next Generation) variant, which carries forward the lineage of the BRAHMOS weapons system. This new centre would be ready over the next two to three years and will commence production at a rate of 80-100 BRAHMOS-NG missiles per year.
Congratulating the scientists and engineers of DRDO & BrahMos Aerospace, Shri Rajnath Singh exuded confidence that the two units will play a pivotal role in bolstering national security, defence production as well as the economy of Uttar Pradesh. He said, the state-of-the-art facilities will prove to be an important milestone in the defence sector. He added that the establishment of these units will generate revenue; provide employment opportunities to the youth and help in achieving ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat’ envisioned by Prime Minister Shri Narendra Modi. He said that the message of Make in India, Make for India and Make for World has been sent out globally.
On the 'Defence Technology and Test Centre', the Raksha Mantri said, the Centre will provide the technological base to develop defence products keeping in mind the young innovators and startups in Amausi region of Uttar Pradesh. He added that the Centre will make all endeavours to fulfil the creative energy, capabilities and aspirations of the youth of Uttar Pradesh. It will help in bringing the MSMEs of Uttar Pradesh together and bring the state at the forefront in the field of defence and aerospace manufacturing, he said. He added that the Centre, through skill development, will create direct and indirect employment in the field of defence and aerospace manufacturing.
Recalling India’s history, Shri Rajnath Singh said “we have never been an aggressor, but are ready to defend our people against any nation with hostile intentions”. He added that the purpose of the BRAHMOS supersonic cruise missile system is to act as a deterrent. He said, the system not only reflects the technical cooperation between India and Russia, but also the long standing cultural, political and diplomatic ties. He termed BRAHMOS as the world's best and fastest precision-guided weapon which has strengthened India's credible deterrence in the 21st century.
The Raksha Mantri added that BRAHMOS has empowered the Armed Forces and raised India's military stature at the international level. On BRAHMOS-NG, he said, the more advanced missile system, which has proven its firepower in land, water and air will greatly strengthen the modern combat capability of the Indian Army in the coming years. He appreciated that the establishment of UP DIC has opened up new avenues for all-round technological progress of the state, besides providing employment opportunities for the youth of the region. “At the time of its inauguration, we had estimated an investment of Rs 3,732 crore. Investment of more than Rs 1,400 crore has already been received and the process is progressing rapidly,” he informed.
Shri Rajnath Singh stated that India has attained a respectable position in areas of defence technologies, including the development of state-of-the-art missile systems in the last few years and has made commendable progress in building its defence industrial base. He applauded scientists of DRDO for their crucial role in increasing India’s military stature by strengthening the Armed Forces and achieving ‘Aatmanirbharta’ in the development and production of modern missile systems. Shri Rajnath Singh ended his address by calling on all in attendance to resolve to raise the State of Uttar Pradesh to new heights.
The Rajnath Singh expressed confidence that the foundation stone laying of the two units heralds a new chapter in the defence of the nation as well as defence manufacturing and the economy of the state of Uttar Pradesh and the city of Lucknow. He applauded the state government under the leadership of Chief Minister Shri Yogi Adityanath for taking various initiatives for improving infrastructure and the welfare & progress of people from all sections of society.
Speaking on the occasion, UP Chief Minister Shri Yogi Adityanath thanked Raksha Mantri Shri Rajnath Singh for the initiatives of Ministry of Defence such as UP DIC, DefExpo-2020 and the establishment of a unt of Bharat Dynamics Limited in Jhansi. He said, the work had started in all six nodes of the UP DIC and that the foundation stone laying of the two units is a fulfilment of the vision of ‘Aatmanirbhar Bharat’ in the defence sector. The Chief Minister added that the units will provide avenues for employment for youth of the state and expressed confidence that the units will make a significant contribution to the progress of the state as also the nation. Shri Yogi Adityanath highlighted Uttar Pradesh’s potential for progress in the defence sector due to the large number of Medium, Small Scale and Micro Enterprises (MSMEs) in the state. He assured all possible support of the state government to defence sector industries coming to the state.
In his opening address, Secretary Department of Defence R&D and Chairman DRDO Dr G Satheesh Reddy thanked the Raksha Mantri for making land available for the DTTC in Lucknow. He expressed gratitude to UP Chief Minister for providing 200 acres of land for the BRAHMOS manufacturing centre. He assured all support from DRDO to the industries coming up in the region.
The state-of-the-art Defence Technologies & Test Centre is being set up to implement the MoU exchanged between Uttar Pradesh Expressways Industrial Development Authority (UPEIDA) and DRDO during DefExpo-2020 at Lucknow in presence of the Raksha Mantri and the UP Chief Minister. The DTTC, Lucknow will follow the design-build-test-learn cycle for technology consultancy & handholding of the Deep-Tech Startups & industries.
It will facilitate industries through establishing a centralized state of the art technology infrastructure which will accelerate the product development and reduce the induction time & the turnaround time for the futuristic systems development through its 6 subcentres. This unique setup will act as a bridge for Industries & Startups to grasp the DRDO’s IPRs, Patents & ToTs. It will extend holistic handholding to Industries, Startups & Academia in UP DIC. It will promote the growth of Industries & Startups in UPDIC and Ease of Doing Business and contribute to building an AtmaNirbhar Bharat.
The BRAHMOS supersonic cruise missile system is one of the most successful missile programmes in the world. India has undertaken jointly in partnership with its closest strategic ally Russia. As the world’s best and fastest precision-guided weapon, BRAHMOS has fortified India’s deterrence power in 21st century. Designed and developed by India-Russia JV entity BrahMos Aerospace, supersonic cruise missile BRAHMOS has continued to evolve as the most versatile weapon in its genre. To carry forward this excellent lineage, BrahMos Aerospace has initiated work on a new, more advanced variant of the missile - BRAHMOS-NG. This new missile, having smaller, lighter and smarter dimensions, would be designed for deployment on a wider number of modern military platforms, including land, sea, underwater and air. It will hugely bolster Indian military’s modern combat capability and flexibility in the next few years.
Union Minister of State for Housing & Urban Affairs Shri Kaushal Kishore, UP Industrial Development Minister Shri Satish Mahana; other Ministers of the state government; MPs, MLAs and public representatives from the state; officials of Ministry of Defence, DRDO and the state government were present on the occasion.
中文原文: 相信他们将在支持国家安全、国防生产和经济方面发挥关键作用这些单位将创造收入，为年轻人提供就业机会，并帮助实现“Aatmanirbhar Bharat”：RM2021年12月26日Raksha Mantri Shri Rajnath Singh为国防技术与测试中心和布拉莫斯制造中心奠定了基石，该中心由国防研究与发展组织(DRDO)于2021年12月26日在北方邦勒克瑙建立。这两个单位的基础是在北方邦首席部长Shri Yogi Adityanath在场的情况下奠定的。第一个国防技术和测试中心(DTTC)，占地约22英亩，正在建立，以加快北方邦国防工业走廊（UP DIC）国防和航空航天制造业集群的发展。它将由以下六个次级中心组成：1.深科技创新及创业孵化中心2.设计与仿真中心3.测试与评估中心4.工业4.0/数码制造中心5.技能发展中心6.商业发展中心布拉莫斯制造中心由布拉莫斯航空航天公司宣布，是位于UP DIC勒克瑙节点的一个现代化、最先进的设施。它将占地200多英亩，生产新的布拉莫斯-NG（下一代）变种，继承了布拉莫斯武器系统的血统。这个新中心将在未来两到三年内准备就绪，并将开始以每年80-100枚布拉莫斯-NG导弹的速度生产。Shri Rajnath Singh向DRDO&BrahMos Aerospace的科学家和工程师表示祝贺，并表示相信这两个单位将在支持国家安全、国防生产和北方邦经济方面发挥关键作用。他说，最先进的设施将被证明是国防部门的一个重要里程碑。他补充说，这些单位的成立将产生收入；为青年提供就业机会，并帮助实现总理什里·纳伦德拉·莫迪所设想的“Aatmanirbhar Bharat”。他说，印度制造、为印度制造、为世界制造的信息已经在全球发出。关于“国防技术和测试中心”，Raksha Mantri说，该中心将为开发国防产品提供技术基础，同时铭记北方邦阿莫西地区的年轻创新者和初创企业。他补充说，该中心将尽一切努力实现北方邦青年的创造力、能力和愿望。他说，这将有助于将北方邦的中小企业团结起来，并使该州在国防和航空航天制造领域处于前列。他补充说，该中心通过技能开发，将在国防和航空航天制造领域创造直接和间接就业机会。Shri Rajnath Singh回顾了印度的历史，他说，“我们从来不是侵略者，但我们准备保护我们的人民免受任何怀有敌对意图的国家的攻击”。他补充说，布拉莫斯超音速巡航导弹系统的目的是起到威慑作用。他说，该系统不仅反映了印度和俄罗斯之间的技术合作，也反映了长期的文化、政治和外交关系。他称布拉莫斯是世界上最好和最快的精确制导武器，加强了印度在21世纪的可信威慑。拉克沙·曼特里补充说，布拉莫斯赋予了武装部队权力，并提高了印度在国际上的军事地位。他说，在布拉莫斯-吴方面，更先进的导弹系统已经证明了其在陆、水和空中的火力，将在未来几年大大加强印度军队的现代作战能力。他赞赏UP DIC的建立为国家的全面技术进步开辟了新的途径，并为该地区的青年提供了就业机会。“在它成立时，我们估计投资为3732卢比。已经收到超过1400卢比的投资，这一进程进展迅速，“他通知说。Shri Rajnath Singh指出，印度在国防技术领域取得了可敬的地位，包括在过去几年中发展最先进的导弹系统，并在建设国防工业基础方面取得了值得称赞的进展。他赞扬了DRDO的科学家们在提高印度军事地位方面发挥的关键作用，他们加强了武装部队，并在现代导弹系统的开发和生产中实现了“Aatmanirbharta”。Shri Rajnath Singh在讲话结束时呼吁所有与会者决心将北方邦提高到新的高度。拉杰纳特·辛格表示相信，这两个单位的奠基预示着国防、国防制造业和欧盟的新篇章

中文标题: 美国利用人工智能实现核材料研究新突破
情报来源: 美国阿贡国家实验室网站
整编内容:
美国能源部（DOE）阿贡国家实验室正在尝试用人工智能（AI），基于深度学习的多目标追踪（MOT）算法，从视频中提取数据进行分析，进而优化先进核反应堆设计。研究结果发表在《科学报告》（Scientific Reports）杂志上。
如果需要建造耐温更好的反应堆，就需要开发能耐受更高温度和更高辐照剂量的材料。通过计算机视觉工具，研究人员可从视频中获得所需数据。目前，将原位辐照透射电子显微镜（TEM）视频数据转换为缺陷团簇动态特性（如寿命）信息已成为主要的技术瓶颈。为此他们提出了DefectTrack方案，并在测试集上取得了66.43%的MOTA和67.81%的大多数跟踪（MT），这与最先进的MOT算法相当。研究中，DefectTrack在一分钟内跟踪了4378个不同的缺陷群，其寿命从19.4到64毫秒不等，据评估表明，其在准确性和速度上优于人类专家。
此外，中压电子显微镜（IVEM）是该项目的重要设施，它由透射电子显微镜和离子束加速器构成，可在变化发生时（原地）观察由离子辐照引起的材料变化。该团队收集了大量关于耐温性、抗辐照性、微结构缺陷和材料寿命的可靠信息，从而为不同能量对核反应堆材料影响研究奠定基础。
目前，核能电力生产效率比任何其他清洁能源都高，该团队认为，DefectTrack计算机视觉可增强现代化核电技术的安全性和可靠性，并能减少温室气体排放，从而有效促进清洁电力发展。
整编机构: 中国航发航材院
源标题: Artificial intelligence reframes nuclear material studies
原文:
Computer vision expands the value of video recording science experiments
The future of nuclear energy, which can produce electricity without harmful emissions, depends on discovery of new materials. A scientist at Argonne is using computer vision to separate the best candidates from a crowded field.
If a picture can tell a thousand words, imagine the frame-by-frame story that can be gleaned from a single video. Five minutes of video containing 200 frames per second can result in 60,000 images — a visual ?“Moby Dick.” Sound tedious to digest and catalog? It is, which explains why scientists don’t usually analyze their experiments’ videos in such detail.
Wei-Ying Chen, a principal materials scientist in the nuclear materials group at the Department of Energy’s (DOE) Argonne National Laboratory, is experimenting with advances in artificial intelligence (AI) to change that. The deep learning-based multi-object tracking (MOT) algorithm he uses to extract data from videos, as detailed in a recently published study, aims to help the U.S. improve advanced nuclear reactor designs. In turn, modernized nuclear power would better produce safe, reliable electricity without releasing harmful greenhouse gases.
“We want to build advanced reactors that can run at higher temperatures, so we need to discover materials that are resistant to higher temperature and higher irradiation dose. With computer vision tools, we are on track to get all the data we need from all of the video frames.” — Wei-Ying Chen, Argonne National Laboratory
Currently, nuclear energy produces more electricity on less land than any other clean energy source. Many commercial nuclear reactors, which supply nearly 20% of total U.S. electricity, use older materials and technology. Scientists and engineers believe newer materials and advanced designs could substantially increase the percentage of clean electricity generated by nuclear power plants.
“We want to build advanced reactors that can run at higher temperatures, so we need to discover materials that are resistant to higher temperature and higher irradiation dose,” said Chen. ?“With computer vision tools, we are on track to get all the data we need from all of the video frames.”
Chen assists users and conducts experiments at Argonne’s Intermediate Voltage Electron Microscope (IVEM) facility, a national user facility and a partner facility of DOE’s Nuclear Science User Facilities (NSUF). The IVEM – part transmission electron microscope, part ion beam accelerator — is one of about a dozen instruments in the world that let researchers look at material changes caused by ion irradiation as the changes happen (in situ). This means scientists like Chen can study the effects of different energies on materials proposed for use in future nuclear reactors.
Scientist standing in front of equipment. (Image by Seth Hoffman/Argonne National Laboratory.)
Part transmission electron microscope, part ion beam accelerator, Argonne’s IVEM is one of about a dozen instruments in the world that lets researchers study material changes caused by ion irradiation as they happen. Chen conducts and facilitates user experiments at the facility. (Image by Seth Hoffman/Argonne National Laboratory.)
Understanding why, where and when materials break down and show defects under extreme conditions over the course of their lifetimes is critical in order to judge a material’s suitability for use in a nuclear reactor. Extremely tiny defects are the first signs that a material will corrode, become brittle or fail. During experiments, defects happen within a picosecond, or one-trillionth of a second. At high temperatures, these defects appear and disappear in tens of milliseconds. Chen is an expert in IVEM experiments and said even he struggles to plot and interpret such fast-moving data.
The fleeting nature of defects during experiments explains why scientists traditionally captured only a smattering of data points along important lines of mea
With Argonne funding, Chen has spent the past two years developing computer vision to track material changes from recorded experiments at IVEM. In one project, he examined 100 frames per second from videos one to two minutes long. In another, he extracted one frame per second in videos one to two hours long.
Similar to facial recognition software that can recognize and track people in surveillance footage, the computer vision at IVEM singles out material defects and structural voids. Instead of establishing a library of faces, Chen builds a vast, reliable collection of information about temperature resistance, irradiation resilience, microstructural defects and material lifetimes. This information can be plotted to inform better models and plan better experiments.
Chen stresses that saving time — a frequently cited benefit of computer-enabled work — isn’t the exclusive benefit of using AI and computer vision at IVEM. With a greater ability to understand and steer experiments that are underway, IVEM users can make on-the-spot adjustments to use their time at IVEM more efficiently and capture important information.
“Videos look very nice, and we can learn a lot from them, but too often they get shown one time at a conference and then are not used again,” said Chen. ?“With computer vision, we can actually learn a lot more about observed phenomena and we can convert video of phenomena into more useful data.”
DefectTrack proves itself accurate and reliable
In research published in Scientific Reports, Chen and co-authors from the University of Connecticut (UConn) presented DefectTrack, a MOT capable of extracting complicated defect data in real time as materials were irradiated.
In the study, DefectTrack tracked up to 4,378 different defect clusters in just one minute, with lifetimes ranging from 19.4 to 64 milliseconds. The findings were starkly superior to the same work by human counterparts.
“Our statistical evaluations showed that the DefectTrack is more accurate and faster than human experts in analyzing the defect lifetime distribution,” said UConn co-author and Ph.D. candidate Rajat Sainju.
Computer vision has multiple advantages; improved speed and accuracy are among them.
“We urgently need to speed up our understanding of nuclear materials degradation,” said Yuanyuan Zhu, the UConn assistant professor of materials science and engineer who led the university’s team of co-authors. ?“Dedicated computer vision models have the potential to revolutionize analysis and help us better understand the nature of nuclear radiation effects.”
Chen is optimistic that computer vision such as DefectTrack will improve nuclear reactor designs.
“Computer vision can provide information that, from a practical standpoint, was unavailable before,” said Chen. ?“It’s exciting that we now have access to so much more raw data of unprecedented statistical significance and consistency.”
The DOE Office of Nuclear Energy’s mission is to advance nuclear power to meet the nation’s energy, environmental and national security needs. For more information, visit the Office of Nuclear Energy website.
Argonne National Laboratory seeks solutions to pressing national problems in science and technology. The nation’s first national laboratory, Argonne conducts leading-edge basic and applied scientific research in virtually every scientific discipline. Argonne researchers work closely with researchers from hundreds of companies, universities, and federal, state and municipal agencies to help them solve their specific problems, advance America’s scientific leadership and prepare the nation for a better future. With employees from more than 60 nations, Argonne is managed by UChicago Argonne, LLC for the U.S. Department of Energy’s Office of Science.
In-situ irradiation transmission electron microscopy (TEM) offers unique insights into the millisecond-timescale post-cascade process, such as the lifetime and thermal stability of defect clusters, vital to the mechanistic understanding of irradiation damage in nuclear materials. Converting in-situ irradiation TEM video data into meaningful information on defect cluster dynamic properties (e.g., lifetime) has become the major technical bottleneck. Here, we present a solution called the DefectTrack, the first dedicated deep learning-based one-shot multi-object tracking (MOT) model capable of tracking cascade-induced defect clusters in in-situ TEM videos in real-time. DefectTrack has achieved a Multi-Object Tracking Accuracy (MOTA) of 66.43% and a Mostly Tracked (MT) of 67.81% on the test set, which are comparable to state-of-the-art MOT algorithms. We discuss the MOT framework, model selection, training, and evaluation strategies for in-situ TEM applications. Further, we compare the DefectTrack with four human experts in quantifying defect cluster lifetime distributions using statistical tests and discuss the relationship between the material science domain metrics and MOT metrics. Our statistical evaluations on the defect lifetime distribution suggest that the DefectTrack outperforms human experts in accuracy and speed.

整编内容: 朝鲜领导人金正恩2023年1月1日表示，美国以加强与韩国和日本的合作为借口，正在打造一个“亚洲版北约”。2022年，美国在韩国频繁部署各种核打击手段，对朝鲜军事施压最大化。金正恩在朝鲜劳动党全体会议的一份报告中表示，美国打着“加强联盟”的旗号，正在全面推进与日本和韩国的三边合作，同时努力建立一个新的军事集团，就像亚洲版北约。金正恩还指出，在面临严峻外部挑战和当前朝韩紧张关系的情况下，朝鲜非常有必要加强自卫能力。金正恩强调了加强核力量的重要性，并下令开发一种新型洲际弹道导弹系统，以便能够快速报复性核打击。当天早些时候，媒体报道称，金正恩还表示朝鲜新型600毫米多管发射火箭系统的火箭可以携带战术核武器，整个韩国都在射程之内。金正恩还指出，朝鲜有必要增加可以使用的核弹头数量。

源标题: Kim Jong-un Accuses US of Creating ‘Asian Version of NATO’
原文:
2023.01.02
MOSCOW (Sputnik) - North Korean leader Kim Jong-un said on Sunday that the United States, under the pretext of strengthening cooperation with South Korea and Japan, was creating an "Asian version of NATO."
"In 2022 the US frequently deployed various nuclear strike means in South Korea at the level of constant deployment, increasing the level of military pressure on the DPRK [Democratic People's Republic of Korea] to the maximum. And, at the same time, it is pushing forward the realization of triangular cooperation with Japan and South Korea on a full scale while working hard to establish a new military bloc like Asian version of NATO under the signboard of ‘tightening alliance," Kim Jong-un said in a report on the Workers' Party of Korea plenary meeting, as cited by local media.
The North Korean leader also noted the importance of strengthening the self-defense capabilities of Pyongyang amid serious external challenges and the current state of inter-Korean relations.
In addition, Kim Jong Un said that the nuclear forces of North Korea would carry out the "second mission", not the defensive one, in the event of a threat to the country.
"Stressing the importance of bolstering the nuclear force, the report made clear that our nuclear force considers it as the first mission to deter war and safeguard peace and stability and, however, if it fails to deter, it will carry out the second mission, which will not be for defense," the report said.
The North Korean leader also ordered the development of a new intercontinental ballistic missile system to conduct a quick nuclear retaliatory strike.
He also called the current geopolitical situation a "new Cold War."
Earlier in the day, the media reported that Kim Jong Un also said that rockets of the new North Korean 600-millimeter multiple-launch rocket systems could carry tactical nuclear weapons, and all of South Korea is within their reach. The North Korean leader also noted the need to increase the number of nuclear warheads at the disposal of the country.
Lately North Korea was actively carrying missile tests. In 2022, North Korea has conducted nearly 40 test-launches, firing around 70 missiles, including an intercontinental ballistic missile test-fired in November. The tests came in response to joint US-South Korea drills in the region.
中文原文: 2023.01.02莫斯科（人造卫星）--朝鲜领导人金正恩周日表示，美国以加强与韩国和日本的合作为借口，正在创建一个“亚洲版的北约”“2022年，美国频繁在韩国部署各种核打击手段，不断部署，最大限度地增加了对朝鲜（朝鲜民主主义人民共和国）的军事压力。据当地媒体援引，金正恩在朝鲜劳动党全体会议的一份报告中表示：”与此同时，它正在推动与日本和韩国全面实现三角合作，同时努力建立一个像亚洲版北约一样的新军事集团，打着‘加强联盟’的招牌。“这位朝鲜领导人还指出，在严峻的外部挑战和朝韩关系的现状下，加强平壤自卫能力的重要性。此外，金正恩表示，朝鲜的核力量将在国家受到威胁的情况下执行“第二项任务”，而不是防御性任务。报告称：“该报告强调了加强核力量的重要性，明确表示我们的核力量认为这是阻止战争和维护和平与稳定的第一项任务，然而，如果它不能阻止，它将执行第二项任务，这将不是为了防御。”朝鲜领导人还下令开发新的洲际弹道导弹系统，以进行快速核报复性打击。他还称当前的地缘政治局势为“新冷战”当天早些时候，媒体报道称，金正恩还表示，朝鲜新型600毫米多管发射火箭系统的火箭可以携带战术核武器，韩国全境都在他们的触手可及范围内。这位朝鲜领导人还指出，有必要增加该国拥有的核弹头数量。最近，朝鲜积极进行导弹试验。2022年，朝鲜进行了近40次试射，发射了约70枚导弹，包括11月试射的一枚洲际弹道导弹。这些试验是对美韩在该地区联合演习的回应。

中文标题: 美国AM通用公司获得联合轻型战术车合同
整编内容:
美国AM通用公司击败奥施科施防务公司，获得陆军授予的合同，为美国武装部队制造联合轻型战术车。合同价值86.6亿美元，为期10年。初始生产合同价值2.9亿美元。AM通用公司将在5年内生产2万辆联合轻型战术车和1万辆联合轻型战术车拖车。
美国陆军2015年与奥施科施防务公司签订联合轻型战术车的初始合同，并订购了A1联合轻型战术车和A2联合轻型战术车的战术数据包，作为整体成本节约战略的一部分。因为军方拥有联合轻型战术车数据包，可以在升级车辆时继续开展该项目的招标工作，方便美国陆军在升级车辆时降低成本。自签订合同以来，奥施科施防务公司已交付1.9万辆联合轻型战术车和3500辆联合轻型战术车拖车，并将在2023年11月之前继续交付车辆。
AM通用公司的技术升级包括加强防腐性能和提高燃油效率。该公司将在其位于印第安纳州米沙瓦卡的军事设施生产联合轻型战术车，并在17个月内交付首批2万辆联合轻型战术车。该公司还将在印第安纳工厂的现场测试轨道上测试联合轻型战术车。
A2联合轻型战术车是美国陆军首款使用锂离子电池的战术轮式车。根据美国陆军2022年2月发布的《陆军气候战略》，美国陆军重点关注车辆燃油效率和电气化、作战发电、电池存储等领域。
联合轻型战术车及其各种变型车将通过共享通用部件、维护程序和训练来提高长期可持续性，降低使用成本。
除陆军之外，海军陆战队也在采购联合轻型战术车，这是AM通用公司合同的一部分。预计此次采购合同的约三分之一，即6801辆联合轻型战术车和3485辆联合轻型战术车拖车将列装美国海军陆战队。联合轻型战术车是海军陆战队“部队设计2030”现代化计划测试的技术之一，该计划要求通过放弃坦克和创建新的海军远征部队来建立一支更具远征性的部队。与“部队设计2030”相关的战略决策可能会影响海军陆战队最终采购的联合轻型战术车与拖车的具体数量。海军陆战队计划将联合轻型战术车用作“海军打击导弹”的移动发射平台，并成为海军陆战队远征舰艇拦截系统（NMESIS）的一部分。

源标题: Incumbent Oshkosh Defense falls to AM General in JLTV recompete
原文:
Date Posted: 13-Feb-2023
The US Army awarded AM General a contract to produce its Joint Light Tactical Vehicle that could be worth up to USD8.66 billion. (US Army)
Author: Meredith Roaten, Washington, DC
Publication: Jane's Defence Weekly
UPDATED
Newcomer AM General beat out Oshkosh Defense to manufacture the Joint Light Tactical Vehicle (JLTV) for US armed forces in a deal that could be worth up to USD8.66 billion over 10 years, US Army programme officials said.
Following a competition between the incumbent and AM General, the army selected the latter for a contract for up to 20,000 vehicles and up to 10,000 JLTV-Trailers (JLTV-Ts) for joint and Foreign Military Sales (FMS) in the next five years with options for additional orders in the following five years. AM General's initial production contract is worth USD290 million, according to the Pentagon.
The service had picked Oshkosh Defense for the initial JLTV contract in 2015, and then ordered the A1 and A2 designs' tactical data packages (TDPs) for the vehicle, as part of an overall cost- saving strategy, US Army Brigadier General Samuel Peterson, Program Executive Officer for Combat Support and Combat Service Support (PEO CS&CSS), said in a 9 February statement.
Since the military owns the rights to the JLTV's data package, the army can continue competing the programme to keep prices low when updating future vehicles, he said.
“These government-held data rights permitted the programme to compete this follow-on production contract with much better control of the production configuration and cost,” Brig Gen Peterson said.
AM General's technology upgrades for the new equipment include enhanced corrosion protection and improved fuel efficiency, according to a 9 February company statement. AM General will produce JLTVs in its military facility in Mishawaka, Indiana, and deliver the first of the 20,000 vehicles in 17 months, according to a release. The company will also test the JLTV on the Indiana facility's on-site test track.
Despite the loss, Oshkosh Defense will pursue a debriefing from the government on the decision in “the very near future”, a spokesperson said in a 9 February statement. The statement did not say if the manufacturer will protest the decision.
Oshkosh has delivered 19,000 vehicles and 3,500 trailers since its initial contract to replace the army's Humvee fleet, according to the company's statement. The company will continue delivering vehicles through November 2023, John Bryant, president of Oshkosh Defense, said in January
2022.
The US Army awarded AM General a contract to produce its Joint Light Tactical Vehicle that could be worth up to USD8.66 billion. (US Army)
2043829
The JLTV's fuel efficiency-related capabilities connect it to the army's broader climate change mitigation initiatives. The Army Climate Strategy published in February 2022 lays out areas where the service is seeking improvements, such as vehicle fuel efficiency and electrification, operational power generation, and battery storage.
The JLTV A2 design is the first tactical wheeled vehicle in the service that uses lithium-ion batteries, “a key enabler for anti-idle capability”, the army said in its 9 February statement.
The vehicle's development is expected to improve long-term sustainability by sharing common components, maintenance procedures, and training between different JLTV mission variants to “minimise total ownership cost”, according to the army.
Alongside the army, the marine corps is procuring the JLTV as part of AM General's contract. Ashley Calingo, a spokesperson for Marine Corps Systems Command, said in a 10 February email that while final numbers are still “in flux”, the marines could receive approximately a third of the total contract, up to 6,801 JLTVs and 3,485 trailers.
The JLTV is one of the technologies the marine corps is testing through its modernisation plan dubbed Force Design 2030, which calls for a more expeditionary force through strategies such as ditching tanks and creating new Marine Expeditionary Units (MEUs).
“Strategic decisions related to Force Design 2030 could affect the number of vehicles and trailers the marine corps procures,” Calingo told Janes .
The marine corps plans to use the JLTV as a mobile launch platform for the Naval Strike Missiles (NSMs) as part of the Navy Marine Expeditionary Ship Interdiction System (NMESIS).
中文原文: 公布日期：2023年2月13日美国陆军授予AM General一份合同，生产其联合轻型战术车辆，价值可能高达86.6亿美元。（美国陆军）作者：梅雷迪思·罗滕，华盛顿特区出版物：简氏防务周刊更新美国陆军项目官员表示，新公司AM General击败了Oshkosh Defense为美国武装部队制造联合轻型战术车辆(JLTV)，这笔交易可能在10年内价值高达86.6亿美元。在任职者和AM将军之间的竞争后，陆军选择后者签订一份合同，在未来五年内为联合和外国军事销售(FMS)提供多达20,000辆汽车和多达10,000辆JLTV-Ts拖车，并在未来五年内选择额外的订单。根据五角大楼的数据，AM General最初的生产合同价值2.9亿美元。美国陆军准将将军（Samuel Peterson）在2月9日的一份声明中说，该服务在2015年选择了Oshkosh Defense作为JLTV的初始合同，然后为该车辆订购了A1和A2 designs的战术数据包(TDPs)，作为整体成本节约战略的一部分。他说，由于军方拥有JLTV数据包的权利，军方可以继续竞争该项目，以在更新未来车辆时保持较低的价格。彼得森准将说：“这些政府持有的数据权利允许该项目在更好地控制生产配置和成本的情况下，与后续生产合同竞争。”根据2月9日公司的一份声明，AM General对新设备的技术升级包括增强腐蚀防护和提高燃料效率。根据一份新闻稿，AM General将在其位于印第安纳州米沙瓦卡的军事设施中生产JLTV，并在17个月内交付2万辆车中的第一辆。该公司还将在印第安纳州工厂的现场测试跑道上测试JLTV。一位发言人在2月9日的一份声明中说，尽管失败了，奥什科什国防将在“不久的将来”寻求政府对这一决定的汇报。声明没有说明制造商是否会抗议这一决定。根据该公司的声明，自最初签署取代陆军悍马车队的合同以来，Oshkosh已交付了19000辆汽车和3500辆拖车。奥什科什国防公司总裁约翰·布莱恩特（John Bryant）在1月份表示，该公司将继续交付车辆，直到2023年11月2022年。美国陆军授予AM General一份合同，生产其联合轻型战术车辆，价值可能高达86.6亿美元。（美国陆军）2043829JLTV与燃料效率相关的能力将其与陆军更广泛的气候变化缓解倡议联系起来。2022年2月公布的陆军气候战略列出了该部门寻求改进的领域，如车辆燃料效率和电气化、运行发电和电池存储。陆军在2月9日的声明中表示，JLTV A2设计是首款使用锂离子电池的战术轮式车辆，“锂离子电池是反怠速能力的关键推动者”。根据军方的说法，该车辆的开发预计将通过在不同的JLTV任务变体之间共享公共组件、维护程序和培训来提高长期可持续性，以“最大限度地降低总拥有成本”。与陆军一起，海军陆战队也在采购JLTV作为AM General合同的一部分。海军陆战队系统司令部发言人阿什利·卡林戈（Ashley Calingo）在2月10日的一封电子邮件中表示，尽管最终数字仍在“变化中”，但海军陆战队可能会收到总合同的约三分之一，多达6801辆JLTV和3485辆拖车。JLTV是海军陆战队正在通过其名为2030年部队设计的现代化计划测试的技术之一，该计划呼吁通过抛弃坦克和创建新的海军陆战队远征部队等战略来组建一支更具远征军。“与部队设计2030相关的战略决策可能会影响海军陆战队采购的车辆和拖车的数量，”卡林戈告诉简斯。海军陆战队计划使用JLTV作为海军打击导弹(NSMs)的移动发射平台，作为海军海军陆战队远征舰拦截系统(NMESIS)的一部分。

中文标题: 星链星座和一网星座达成频谱协调计划
整编内容: 6月13日，太空探索技术公司（SpaceX）和一网公司表示，已达成了一项频谱协调计划，双方当前和第二代宽带巨型星座可实现共存。在写给联邦通信委员会（FCC）的一封信中，这两家公司要求FCC忽略此前针对对方提出的频谱协调问题，并希望FCC迅速批准双方各自的第二代系统，以便尽快部署并提供服务。SpaceX公司已获准在近地轨道（LEO）部署4408颗星链卫星，并正在寻求批准再增加约3万多颗卫星，以改善其宽带服务。一网公司已获得了在LEO发射648颗卫星，并希望将卫星数量增至大约7000颗。根据业内人士统计数据，目前轨道上有2404颗星链卫星和427颗一网卫星。目前，SpaceX公司正在美国德克萨斯州研制星舰（Starship）运载器，未来用于发射第2代星链卫星，该卫星长约7米，比第一代卫星大5倍。一网公司曾因俄乌冲突问题，无法继续使用俄罗斯联盟号火箭发射一网卫星，目前已经与SpaceX公司和印度航天研究组织（ISRO）的商业部门签署2022年恢复发射的合同。
整编机构: 中国航天系统科学与工程研究院
源标题: Starlink and OneWeb reach spectrum coordination plan
原文:
by Jason Rainbow — June 14, 2022
SpaceX and OneWeb told the FCC they have settled their spectrum interference differences. Credit: FCC via Flickr
TAMPA, Fla. — SpaceX and OneWeb said June 13 they have reached a spectrum coordination plan that would enable their current and second-generation broadband megaconstellations to coexist.
In a letter to the Federal Communications Commission, the companies asked the regulator to disregard any spectrum coordination issues they had previously filed against each other.
“Given this positive development, the Parties encourage the Commission to quickly approve each second-round system so that they may begin deploying these cutting-edge systems and offering even more advanced services as soon as possible, they said.
SpaceX has permission to deploy 4,408 satellites in low Earth orbit (LEO) for its Starlink network, and is seeking approval to add nearly 30,000 more to improve its broadband services. 
OneWeb has permission for 648 satellites in LEO and wants to grow its constellation to roughly 7,000 satellites.
There are currently 2,404 Starlink and 427 OneWeb satellites in orbit, according to statistics maintained by spaceflight analyst and astronomer Jonathan McDowell.
Starship, the heavy-lift launch vehicle SpaceX is developing in Texas, is critical to the company’s plan to upgrade its Starlink constellation.
Gen 2 Starlink satellites will be nearly seven meters long and five times bigger than its first generation, according to SpaceX founder and CEO Elon Musk.
On June 13, the Federal Aviation Administration concluded a long-awaited review that enables Starship orbital launches from Texas — if the company completes dozens of mitigations to reduce impacts on the environment and the public.
SpaceX has been using Falcon 9 rockets to launch batches of typically 53 Starlink satellites at a time. The next Starlink launch has been slated for June 17 from the Kennedy Space Center in Florida.
Arianespace had been using Russian Soyuz rockets to launch 32-36 satellites per OneWeb mission, however, it had to pause deployments in March following sanctions resulting from Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
OneWeb has signed contracts with SpaceX and the commercial arm of Indian space agency ISRO to resume launches this year.
Amazon and Canadian satellite operator Telesat, which are planning to deploy their own LEO broadband constellations, declined to comment on Starlink and OneWeb’s coordination plan.
Regulatory battles
In a separate June 13 regulatory filing, SpaceX said it had raised nearly $1.68 billion through a private offering of shares as it continues to invest heavily in Starlink and Starship.
Starlink is already the world’s largest megaconstellation, and its expansion plans have met fierce resistance from U.S.-based geostationary satellite broadband operator Viasat.
Viasat has called on the FCC to perform an environmental review of Starlink before allowing the company to expand its network, and in May pointed to light pollution issues it says remain unresolved.
Meanwhile, SpaceX is seeking to block Viasat’s $7.3 billion plan to buy British satellite operator Inmarsat to expand its business internationally and across multiple orbits.
In a letter filed with the FCC June 10, SpaceX said Viasat is unfit to take control of Inmarsat’s spectrum licenses because Viasat is allegedly violating its current frequency rights.
SpaceX accused Viasat of using Ka-band frequencies designated for operators in non-geostationary orbit on a primary basis without first meeting FCC conditions.
“The public interest is not served by giving a company with such blatant disregard for the Commission’s rules control over the Inmarsat satellite system,” SpaceX said in the June 10 letter.
Viasat denies it has violated FCC rules.
“Viasat has previously refuted SpaceX’s baseless claims at length,” Viasat spokesperson Jessica Packard said in a statement. 
“There is nothing new here. We continue to believe that the transaction will serve the public interest and remain confident that the FCC will reach that same conclusion after reviewing the complete record.”
Packard said Viasat remains on course to complete the Inmarsat acquisition before the end of 2022, subject to regulatory clearances and the approval of Viasat shareholders who are due to vote on the deal June 21.
中文原文: 杰森·彩虹-2022年6月14日SpaceX和OneWeb告诉联邦通信委员会，他们已经解决了频谱干扰差异。信用：FCC通过Flickr佛罗里达州坦帕--SpaceX和OneWeb 6月13日表示，他们已经达成了一项频谱协调计划，将使他们目前和第二代宽带兆星共存。在给联邦通信委员会的一封信中，两家公司要求监管机构无视他们此前提交的任何频谱协调问题。他们说：“鉴于这一积极的发展，双方鼓励委员会迅速批准每一个第二轮系统，以便他们可以开始部署这些尖端系统，并尽快提供更先进的服务。SpaceX已获准在低地球轨道(LEO)为其Starlink网络部署4408颗卫星，并正在寻求批准再增加近3万颗卫星，以改善其宽带服务。OneWeb已经获得了在低地轨道上648颗卫星的许可，并希望将其星座扩大到大约7000颗卫星。根据航天分析师和天文学家乔纳森·麦克道尔（Jonathan McDowell）的统计数据，目前轨道上有2404颗Starlink和427颗OneWeb卫星。SpaceX正在德克萨斯州开发的重型运载火箭星舰对该公司升级星链星座的计划至关重要。SpaceX创始人兼首席执行官埃隆·马斯克（Elon Musk）表示，2代星链卫星将有近7米长，比第一代卫星大5倍。6月13日，联邦航空管理局完成了一项期待已久的审查，如果该公司完成数十项减轻措施，以减少对环境和公众的影响，该审查将允许星舰从德克萨斯州轨道发射。SpaceX一直在使用猎鹰9号火箭发射一批典型的53颗星链卫星。下一次星际链接发射定于6月17日在佛罗里达州肯尼迪航天中心进行。阿丽亚娜航天公司一直使用俄罗斯联盟号火箭在每次OneWeb任务中发射32-36颗卫星，然而，在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰导致制裁后，它不得不在3月份暂停部署。OneWeb已经与SpaceX和印度航天局ISRO的商业部门签署了合同，将于今年恢复发射。亚马逊和加拿大卫星运营商Telesat正计划部署自己的低轨宽带星座，它们拒绝对Starlink和OneWeb的协调计划置评。监管之争在6月13日的另一份监管文件中，SpaceX表示，随着继续对Starlink和Starship进行大量投资，它已通过非公开发行股票筹集了近16.8亿美元。Starlink已经是世界上最大的巨型卫星，其扩张计划遭到了总部位于美国的地球静止卫星宽带运营商Viasat的强烈抵制。Viasat呼吁联邦通信委员会在允许Starlink扩大其网络之前对该公司进行环境审查，并在5月份指出光污染问题仍未解决。与此同时，SpaceX正寻求阻止Viasat以73亿美元收购英国卫星运营商Inmarsat的计划，以在国际和多个轨道上扩大业务。在6月10日提交给联邦通信委员会的一封信中，SpaceX表示，Viasat不适合控制国际海事卫星组织的频谱许可证，因为据称Viasat侵犯了其目前的频率权。SpaceX指责Viasat在没有首先满足联邦通信委员会条件的情况下，首先使用了为非地球静止轨道运营商指定的Ka波段频率。SpaceX在6月10日的信中表示：“让一家公司如此公然无视委员会对国际海事卫星组织卫星系统的规则进行控制，并不符合公共利益。”Viasat否认违反了FCC的规定。“Viasat此前详细驳斥了SpaceX的毫无根据的说法，”Viasat发言人杰西卡·帕卡德在一份声明中说。“这里没有什么新鲜事。我们仍然相信这笔交易将符合公众利益，并相信联邦通信委员会在审查完整记录后将得出同样的结论。“帕卡德表示，Viasat仍将在2022年底前完成对Inmarsat的收购，这取决于监管机构的许可和Viasat股东的批准，他们将于6月21日就该交易进行投票。

中文标题: 西班牙在演习活动中使用“搜寻者”无人机
整编内容: 2021年12月9日至13日，FTX-BRIMAR 21演习于萨拉戈萨的圣格雷戈里奥国家训练中心举行，西班牙海军陆战队步兵旅使用“搜寻者”无人机完成了包括实弹射击在内的演练。
整编机构: 航空工业信息中心
源标题: Spanish Navy’s Seeker UAS Passes Maneuvers Including Live-Fire
原文:
March 10, 2022
The Marine Infantry Brigade (BRIMAR), a part of the Tercio de Armada de Infantería de Marina (Marine Infantry Protection Force), deployed its Seeker aircraft from December 9 to 13 at the San Gregorio national training center in Zaragoza, during the FTX-BRIMAR 21 maneuvers.
The Seeker UAS proved a vital asset in the campaign, where intelligence gathering through threat identification, tracking vehicles and other targets, and assessing terrain, routes, and settlements is imperative. The Seeker system was involved in these exercises under the RAPAZ program led by the Subdirectorate-General for Planning, Technology and Innovation, which reports to Spain’s Directorate General of Weapons and Material.
In these particularly demanding live-fire exercises, the Seeker UAS demonstrated its capabilities. The BRIMAR troops were able to take full advantage of the system’s autonomy and range to conduct operations from advantageous locations, even in very adverse weather conditions, with surface winds exceeding 40 knots, and to arrange autonomous takeoffs and landings in conditions providing little to zero visibility, including night flights.
Despite the complex environment, the Seeker UAS was able to deploy smoothly and enabled the BRIMAR to locate targets both day and night due to its dual payload, complete with both a thermal and visible camera. This contributed to the success of the exercises.
During the exercises, the Seeker UAS processed available data sources to supplement the video with information of use to all deployed troops, not just the system operators: the video and data generated was distributed in real time to the BRIMAR control station using VidStream, a secure, high-quality, latency-free video and data transmission system. This was done using the new RF-7800H-MP radios from L3 Harris, which are natively integrated into VidStream. Because of this arrangement, the Seeker UAS was the only system to relay video from its ground position to the control station.
This UAV, developed and produced by GMV and Aurea Avionics, is currently one of the most efficient systems in the Class I Mini segment, with an endurance of 90 minutes, a range of 15 km and a weight of 3.5 kg. Both the Spanish Navy and the Spanish Army received the first Seeker UAS units to reinforce the intelligence, surveillance, and reconnaissance capabilities of the Marine Infantry Protection Force and the Spanish Army’s “Almogávares” VI Paratrooper Brigade, two units that enjoy international prestige as elite forces.
中文原文: 2022年3月10日海军陆战队步兵旅(BRIMAR)是Tercio de Armada de Infantería de Marina（海军陆战队步兵保护部队）的一部分，在FTX-BRIMAR21演习期间，于12月9日至13日在萨拉戈萨的圣格雷戈里奥国家训练中心部署了其导引头飞机。探索者无人机在这场战役中被证明是一项至关重要的资产，在这场战役中，通过威胁识别、跟踪车辆和其他目标以及评估地形、路线和定居点来收集情报是必不可少的。导引头系统参与了RAPAZ计划下的这些演习，该计划由规划、技术和创新总局领导，该总局向西班牙武器和材料总局报告。在这些要求特别高的实弹演习中，导引头无人机展示了它的能力。布里马尔部队能够充分利用该系统的自主性和航程，从有利的地点进行行动，即使在非常不利的天气条件下，地面风速超过40节，并在能见度很低或为零的条件下安排自主起飞和着陆，包括夜间飞行。尽管环境复杂，导引头无人机能够顺利部署，并使布里马号能够白天和晚上定位目标，因为它有双重有效载荷，配有热和可见相机。这有助于演习的成功。在演习期间，导引头无人机处理了可用的数据源，以补充视频，为所有部署的部队提供信息，而不仅仅是系统操作员：生成的视频和数据使用VidStream（一种安全、高质量、无延迟的视频和数据传输系统）实时分发到BRIMAR控制站。这是使用新的RF-7800H-MP无线电从L3哈里斯，这是本地集成到VidStream。由于这种安排，导引头无人机系统是唯一一个将视频从其地面位置中继到控制站的系统。这款无人机由GMV和Aurea航空电子公司研发生产，是目前I类迷你航段中效率最高的系统之一，续航时间90分钟，航程15公里，重量3.5公斤。西班牙海军和西班牙陆军都接收了第一批搜索者无人机部队，以加强海军陆战队步兵保护部队和西班牙陆军“阿尔莫加瓦雷斯”第六伞兵旅的情报、监视和侦察能力，这两个部队作为精英部队享有国际声誉。

中文标题: 美国研发出可改进信息和能量存储性能的新型铁电材料
整编内容: 近日，美国宾夕法尼亚州立大学利用镁掺杂氧化锌研发出信息铁电材料。该研究有望改善数字信息存储性能并减少能源消耗。研究人员表示，可以用这些新材料制造微型电容器，并通过设置极化方向，调整表面电荷为正或负。这个设置是非易失性的，意味着研究人员可以把电容设为正值，并保持，也可以把它设为负值，并保持，最终调试出适合电容器的最佳值。新材料由镁掺杂的氧化锌薄膜制成。该薄膜通过溅射沉积生长，在这个过程中，氩离子被加速发射到目标材料，以足够高的能量撞击，使原子脱离含有镁和锌的靶材。游离的镁和锌原子在气相中移动，直到它们与氧气反应并聚集在涂有铂的氧化铝基材上形成薄膜，从而制造出含有铁电性的材料。该研究促进了电容器的创新，拓展了铁电材料的应用范围，使未来使用低能耗芯片的手机续航一周或更长时间成为可能。
关键词: 镁 氧化锌 铁电材料 数字信息存储 微型电容器 极化方向 氧化锌薄膜 氩离子 氧化铝基材 带隙
整编机构: 国家工业信息安全发展研究中心
源标题: New family of ferroelectric materials raises possibilities for improved information and energy storage
原文:
A new family of materials that could result in improved digital information storage and uses less energy may be possible thanks to a team of Penn State researchers who demonstrated ferroelectricity in magnesium-substituted zinc oxide.
Ferroelectric materials are spontaneous electricly polarized bcause negative and positive charges in the material tend toward opposite sides and with the application of an external electric field reorient. They can be affected by physical force, which is why they are useful for push-button ignitors such as those found in gas grills. They can also be used for data storage and memory, because they remain in one polarized state without additional power and so are low-energy digital storage solutions.
"We've identified a new family of materials from which we can make tiny capacitors and we can set their polarization orientation so that their surface charge is either plus or minus," said Jon-Paul Maria, Penn State professor of materials science and engineering, and co-author of the paper published in the Journal of Applied Physics. "That setting is nonvolatile, meaning we can set the capacitor to plus, and it stays plus, we can set it to minus, it stays minus. And then we can come back and identify how we set that capacitor, at say, an hour ago."
This ability could enable a form of digital storage that does not use as much electricity as other forms.
"This type of storage requires no additional energy," Maria said. "And that's important because many of the computer memories that we use today require additional electricity to sustain the information, and we use a substantial amount of the American energy budget on information."
The new materials are made with magnesium-substituted zinc oxide thin films. The film was grown via sputter deposition, a process where argon ions are accelerated towards the target materials, impacting it with a high enough energy to break atoms free from the target that contains magnesium and zinc. The freed magnesium and zinc atoms travel in a vapor phase until they react with oxygen and collect on a platinum-coated aluminum oxide substrate and form the thin films.
Researchers have studied magnesium-substituted zinc oxide as a method of increasing zinc oxide's band gap, a key material characteristic that is important for creating semiconductors. However, the material was never explored for ferroelectricity. Nonetheless, the researchers believed that the material could be made ferroelectric, based on an idea of "ferroelectrics everywhere" posited by Maria and Susan Trolier-McKinstry, Evan Pugh University Professor, Steward S. Flaschen Professor of Ceramic Science and Engineering, and co-author on the paper.
"Generally speaking, ferroelectricity often occurs in minerals that are complicated from a structure and chemistry point of view," Maria said. "And our team proposed the idea about two years ago, that there are other simpler crystals in which this useful phenomenon could be identified, as there were some clues that made us propose this possibility. To say 'ferroelectrics everywhere' is a bit of a play on words, but it captures the idea that there were materials around us that were giving us hints, and we were ignoring those hints for a long time."
Trolier-McKinstry's research career has focused on ferroelectrics, including the search for better ferroelectric materials with different properties. She noted that the University of Kiel in Germany had found the very first of this surprising type of ferroelectric materials in 2019 in nitrides, but that she and Maria have demonstrated comparable behavior in an oxide.
Part of the process Trolier-McKinstry and Maria's group followed is developing a figure of merit, a quantity used in sciences such as analytical chemistry and materials research that characterizes the performance of a device, material or method relative to alternatives.
"As we look at any application for material, we often devise a figure of merit that says what combination of materials properties we would need for any given application to make it as effective as possible," said Trolier-McKinstry. "And this new family of ferroelectrics, it gives us whole new possibilities for those figures of merit. It's very appealing for applications that historically we haven't had great materials sets for, so this kind of new materials development tends to spark new applications."
An added benefit of the magnesium-substituted zinc oxide thin films is how they can be deposited at much lower temperatures than other ferroelectric materials.
"The overwhelming majority of electronic materials are prepared with the assistance of high temperatures, and high temperatures means anywhere from 300 to 1000 degrees Celsius (572 to 1835 degrees Fahrenheit)," said Maria. "Whenever you make materials at elevated temperatures, it comes with a lot of difficulties. They tend to be engineering difficulties, but nonetheless they make everything more challenging. Consider that every capacitor needs two electrical contacts—if I prepare my ferroelectric layer at high temperatures on at least one of these contacts, at some point an unwanted chemical reaction will occur. So, when you can make things at low temperatures, you can integrate them much more easily."
The next step for the new materials is making them into capacitators that are approximately 10 nanometers thick and 20 to 30 nanometers in lateral dimensions, which is a difficult engineering challenge. The researchers need to create a way to control the growth of the materials so there are no issues such as imperfections in the materials. Trolier-McKinstry said that solving these issues will be key to whether these materials are usable in new technologies—cell phones with chips that use much less energy, allowing sustained operation for a week or more.
"When developing new materials, you have to find out how they fail, and then understand how to mitigate those failure mechanisms," Trolier-McKinstry said. "And for every single application, you need to decide what are the essential properties, and how will they evolve over time. And until you've made some measurements on that, you don't know what the big challenges are going to be, and the reliability and manufacturability are huge in terms of whether this material ends up in your cell phone in five years."
中文原文: 宾夕法尼亚州立大学的一组研究人员展示了镁取代氧化锌的铁电性，这使得一种新的材料家族可能会导致数字信息存储的改善，并使用更少的能量。铁电材料具有自发电极化特性，使材料中的负电荷和正电荷倾向于相反的方向，并在外加电场的作用下重新定向。它们可能会受到物理力的影响，这就是为什么它们对按钮式点火器很有用，比如在煤气烤架中发现的点火器。它们还可以用于数据存储和存储器，因为它们保持在一个极化状态而无需额外的功率，低能耗数字存储解决方案也是如此。宾夕法尼亚州立大学材料科学与工程教授乔恩-保罗·玛丽亚（Jon-Paul Maria）说：“我们已经发现了一种新的材料家族，我们可以用它来制造微型电容器，我们可以设置它们的极化方向，以便它们的表面电荷为正负。”乔恩-保罗·玛丽亚是发表在《应用物理学杂志》上的论文的合著者。“这种设置是非易失性的，这意味着我们可以将电容设置为+，它保持为+，我们可以将其设置为负，它保持为负。然后我们可以回来确定我们是如何设置电容的，比如说，一个小时前。”这种能力可以实现一种不像其他形式那样耗电的数字存储形式。“这种类型的存储不需要额外的能量，”玛丽亚说。“这很重要，因为我们今天使用的许多计算机存储器需要额外的电力来维持信息，我们在信息上使用了美国相当大的能源预算。”这种新材料是用镁取代的氧化锌薄膜制成的。该薄膜是通过溅射沉积生长的，在溅射沉积过程中，氩离子加速流向目标材料，以足够高的能量撞击目标材料，使原子从含有镁和锌的目标材料中分离出来。释放出的镁和锌原子在气相中移动，直到它们与氧气反应，聚集在铂涂层的氧化铝衬底上，形成薄膜。研究人员已经将镁取代氧化锌作为一种增加氧化锌带隙的方法进行了研究，氧化锌带隙是一种关键的材料特性，对制造半导体非常重要。然而，这种材料从未被探索用于铁电性。尽管如此，研究人员还是相信这种材料可以被制成铁电材料，这是基于埃文·普格大学教授玛丽亚和苏珊·特罗利耶-麦金太里（Susan Trolier-McKinstry）提出的“铁电无处不在”的想法，她是陶瓷科学与工程教授斯图尔特·S·弗拉斯辰（Steward S.Flaschen）和该论文的合著者。“一般来说，铁电性通常发生在从结构和化学角度来看复杂的矿物中，”玛丽亚说。“大约两年前，我们的团队提出了一个想法，即还有其他更简单的晶体可以识别这种有用的现象，因为有一些线索让我们提出了这种可能性。说‘到处都是铁电体’有点玩弄文字，但它抓住了这样一个想法，即我们周围有材料给我们暗示，而我们长期以来一直忽视这些暗示。”Trolier-McKinstry的研究生涯一直专注于铁电学，包括寻找具有不同性质的更好的铁电材料。她指出，德国基尔大学于2019年在氮化物中发现了第一种这种令人惊讶的铁电材料，但她和玛丽亚在氧化物中展示了类似的行为。Trolier-McKinstry和Maria的团队遵循的过程的一部分是开发一个价值数字，这是一个在分析化学和材料研究等科学中使用的量，描述设备、材料或方法相对于替代品的性能。Trolier-McKinstry说：“当我们考虑任何材料的应用时，我们通常会设计一个价值数字，说明任何给定的应用需要什么样的材料属性组合才能尽可能有效。”“这个新的铁电材料家族，为我们提供了这些优点的全新可能性。对于历史上我们没有伟大材料集的应用来说，它非常有吸引力，所以这种新材料的发展往往会引发新的应用。”替代镁的氧化锌薄膜的另一个好处是它们可以在比其他铁电材料低得多的温度下沉积。玛丽亚说：“绝大多数电子材料是在高温的帮助下制备的，高温意味着300到1000摄氏度（572到1835华氏度）。”“每当你在高温下制造材料时，都会遇到很多困难。它们往往是工程上的困难，但尽管如此，它们还是让一切变得更加具有挑战性。想想每一个

中文标题: 美国就竞争法案加入半导体税收优惠问题产生分歧
整编内容: 近日，美国参议院和众议院领导人共同参加了一次公开会议，会议内容就先前颁布的“竞争法案”中关于支持美国半导体制造业的相关问题展开激烈讨论。会议中，众议院共和党人对关于在竞争法案中加入半导体税收优惠问题上产生意见分歧。德克萨斯州众议员凯文·布雷迪（Kevin Brady）是税收委员会的最高共和党成员。他认为，在国会旨在让美国在中国领先的行业取得更好的地位之际，给半导体芯片制造商减税是一种过于狭隘的做法。竞争法案的会议谈判代表、内布拉斯加州共和党众议员阿德里安·史密斯（Adrian Smith）提出同样的担忧，即半导体信贷太窄，芯片不是美国目前面临的唯一供应链问题。另一方面，其他众议院共和党人则表示不同意，并希望看到涵盖高达25%的半导体芯片财产或设计支出投资的税收抵免能成为竞争法案的一部分。最后，监督税收的筹款委员会的资深共和党人宾夕法尼亚州众议员迈克·凯利（Mike Kelly）表示，布雷迪和史密斯的担忧是有道理的，并建议他们可以对该法案提出修正案。
关键词: 竞争法案 半导体芯片制造业 税收优惠 意见分歧

源标题: Republicans split on adding semiconductor tax breaks to competition bill
原文:
An effort to add bipartisan tax incentives for U.S. semiconductor manufacturing to a larger economic competitiveness package is running into divisions among House Republicans.
The top-ranking GOP member of the tax-writing Ways and Means Committee, Rep. Kevin Brady of Texas, is among those who believe giving tax breaks to chipmakers is too narrow an approach as Congress aims to get the U.S. on better footing in sectors where China leads. But Republicans who proposed the semiconductor tax credits want to see swift action, citing an urgent need for the country to attract semiconductor plants.
"I just don't see the need for a tax title if it … just favors a single industry," Brady said Friday in a brief interview.
The Senate Finance Committee's highest-ranking members—Sens. Ron Wyden, D-Ore., and Michael D. Crapo, R-Idaho—are leading the push to add tax provisions to the competitiveness package as 107 lawmakers embark on the conference process to iron out differences between House and Senate versions of legislation on the subject. The effort kicked off with a public meeting Thursday in which disagreement on potential tax additions emerged.
The packages currently each include funding to bolster U.S. semiconductor manufacturing. But Wyden and Crapo want to add tax incentives along with a provision allowing companies to again fully and immediately deduct their research and development expenses after a 2017 law change required expensing over five years starting on Jan. 1, 2022.
Brady said Congress should focus on boosting all industries China pinpointed in a 2015 economic plan meant to expand its manufacturing sector by 2025, which include power, agricultural, modern rail and aerospace equipment; medical devices; advanced information technology; robotics; high-tech shipping; and more.
Brady said adding the R&D expensing provision, which he supports, is not enough to assuage his concerns.
"That is not enough to help those industries confront and counter China, no question," Brady said. "But hopefully there will be broader discussion than just another tax credit that's sort of double-dipping on top of the $52 billion that they're going to receive in the bill, you know, in grants."
Ways and Means Republican Rep. Adrian Smith of Nebraska, a conference negotiator for the competitiveness package, raised the same concern that semiconductor credits are too narrow, saying chips aren't the only supply chain issue the U.S. currently faces. He said broad-based incentives would make sense, naming the R&D provision as an example that would address that concern.
Still, Smith isn't wedded to the idea of adding tax provisions to the larger package and said he won't insist R&D gets in, though he would support it.
Other House Republicans disagree and want to see the tax credits covering up to 25 percent of investments in semiconductor facility property or design expenditures become part of the competitiveness package.
Pennsylvania Rep. Mike Kelly, the ranking Republican on the Ways and Means subcommittee overseeing taxes, said he wants to see the credits added during the conference. Kelly is a co-sponsor of the House semiconductor credits bill, which is led by Texas Republican Michael McCaul. Republican Conference Chair Elise Stefanik of New York is also a co-sponsor.
Kelly said Brady and Smith's concerns are valid and suggested they could offer amendments to the bill. "But I think we're pretty much now at rug-cutting time," he said. "We're either going to get back in the market, we're either going to get back into being able to do the things that we need to do without relying on others, or we're not."
Democratic Rep. Dan Kildee of Michigan, a co-sponsor of the semiconductor bill and a member of the conference committee, said if lawmakers add a tax title they should do all they can, even if the final package loses votes.
"I think we need to be as bold as we can be and still be able to pass the bill in the Senate," Kildee said. "So I mean, I would favor including everything for which we can get 218 votes and 51 votes over there, knowing that all this legislation's fairly well-vetted."
"People know what it is; it's not like there's a lot of drafting required. It's really a political question," Kildee added.
中文原文: 众议院共和党人正在努力将对美国半导体制造业的两党税收激励措施添加到更大的经济竞争力一揽子计划中，但这一努力在众议院共和党人中遇到了分歧。德克萨斯州众议员凯文·布雷迪（Kevin Brady）是税务撰写筹款委员会的共和党高级成员之一，他认为向芯片制造商提供税收减免的方法过于狭隘，因为国会的目标是让美国在中国领先的领域有更好的基础。但提出半导体税收抵免的共和党人希望看到迅速采取行动，理由是该国迫切需要吸引半导体工厂。布雷迪周五在一次简短的采访中说：“如果税收头衔……只有利于一个行业，我就不认为有必要。”参议院财政委员会最高级别的成员--森斯罗恩·怀登，多雷。爱达荷州共和党人迈克尔·D·克拉波（Michael D.Crapo）正在带头推动在竞争力一揽子计划中增加税收条款，因为107名议员开始了会议进程，以消除众议院和参议院在这一问题上的立法版本之间的分歧。这项努力始于周四的一次公开会议，会上出现了对潜在增税的分歧。目前，每个一揽子计划都包括支持美国半导体制造业的资金。但怀登和克拉波希望增加税收激励措施，以及一项允许公司再次全面立即扣除研发费用的条款，此前2017年的法律修改要求从2022年1月1日起在五年内进行费用支出。布雷迪说，国会应该专注于提振中国2015年经济计划中确定的所有行业，该计划旨在到2025年扩大其制造业，包括电力、农业、现代铁路和航空航天设备；医疗器械；先进的信息技术；机器人学；高科技航运；还有更多。布雷迪说，增加他支持的研发费用条款不足以减轻他的担忧。布雷迪说：“毫无疑问，这不足以帮助这些行业对抗中国。”“但希望会有更广泛的讨论，而不仅仅是另一项税收抵免，这是他们将在法案中获得的520亿美元赠款基础上的二次下降。”内布拉斯加州共和党众议员阿德里安·史密斯（Adrian Smith）是竞争力一揽子计划的会议谈判代表，他提出了同样的担忧，即半导体信贷过于狭窄，称芯片不是美国目前面临的唯一供应链问题。他说，基础广泛的激励措施是有意义的，并列举了研发条款作为解决这一问题的例子。尽管如此，史密斯并不坚持在更大的一揽子计划中增加税收条款的想法，并表示他不会坚持研发进入，尽管他会支持。其他众议院共和党人不同意，他们希望看到涵盖半导体设施、房地产或设计支出投资最多25%的税收抵免成为竞争力一揽子计划的一部分。宾夕法尼亚州众议员迈克·凯利（Mike Kelly）是监督税收的筹款小组委员会的资深共和党人，他说，他希望看到会议期间增加抵免额。凯利是众议院半导体信贷法案的共同提案人，该法案由德克萨斯州共和党人迈克尔·麦卡勒领导。纽约共和党会议主席伊莉斯·斯特凡尼克也是共同发起人。凯利说，布雷迪和史密斯的担忧是有效的，并建议他们可以对该法案提出修正案。“但我认为我们现在几乎到了剪地毯的时候，”他说。“我们要么回到市场，要么回到能够在不依赖他人的情况下做我们需要做的事情，要么我们没有。”密歇根州的民主党众议员丹·基尔迪（Dan Kildee）是半导体法案的共同提案人和会议委员会成员，他说，如果立法者增加一个税项，他们应该尽一切努力，即使最终方案失去了选票。基尔迪说：“我认为我们需要尽可能大胆，并仍然能够在参议院通过该法案。”“所以我的意思是，我倾向于包括我们可以获得218票和51票的一切，因为我知道所有这些立法都经过了相当好的审查。”“人们知道它是什么；这并不需要很多起草工作。这真的是一个政治问题，”基尔迪补充道。

中文标题: 数字化转型和人工智能对作战人员保持战场优势的重要性
整编内容: 2022年6月8日，美国防部首席信息官约翰·B·谢尔曼和首席数字和人工智能官克雷格·马泰尔，在美国防部数字和人工智能研讨会上，围绕“数字化转型和人工智能对作战人员保持战场优势的重要性”主题，从国防部与工业界的关系、挖掘中小型企业、人工智能应用、网络安全等方面展开了讨论。

源标题: Digital Transformation, AI Important in Keeping Battlefield Edge, Leaders Say
原文:
Defense Department officials discussed the importance of digital transformation and artificial intelligence in enabling warfighters to maintain a battlefield advantage, even as China and Russia develop their own AI for military purposes.? 
John B. Sherman, DOD's chief information officer, held a fireside chat June 8 with Craig Martell, DOD's chief digital and artificial intelligence officer, at the DOD Digital and AI Symposium. ? 
Sherman congratulated Martell on his appointment to this new leadership position. He brings a valuable industry perspective to the team, Sherman said, noting that Martell has only been on the job for three days and is hitting the ground running.?? 
The chief of digital and artificial intelligence, which uses the acronym CDAO, reached Full Operating Capability June 1 and is charged with leading and overseeing DOD's strategy development and policy formulation for data, analytics and AI; breaking down barriers to data and AI adoption within appropriate DOD institutional processes; and creating enabling digital infrastructure and services that support Components' development and deployment of data, analytics, AI and digital-enabled solutions. 
Sherman noted that the CDAO has his hands full of real-world operational requirements, including such diverse things as the war in Ukraine, business analytics, counter unmanned aerial systems and data governance.? 
Army Staff Sgt. Elise Denning, with the Artificial Intelligence Integration Center, conducts maintenance on an unmanned aerial system in preparation for Project Convergence at Yuma Proving Ground, Ariz., Oct. 20, 2021. During the testing, Soldiers are experimenting with ways to use UAS to do autonomous target sensing and artificial intelligence, helping soldiers see on the battlefield.
Martell said he will focus not only on the fight today but also future fights five or 10 years later.? 
"We need to find the gaps, the right places where we can leverage value, and then that value is going to drive a virtuous cycle of change," Martell said. "A lot of folks think that DOD should be more like industry. Some of that is true. But [there are] a lot of things about the DOD that can't be more like industry. … We need to find out how to keep the DOD but also make it more efficient and work better." 
Sherman mentioned that his and Martell's work involves a lot of coordination and communications with the military services, the Defense Information Systems Agency and combatant commanders regarding everything they do, such as the Artificial Intelligence and Data Accelerator and digital services. They are the ultimate customers.? 
The team, Sherman continued, constantly thinks about what sort of AI and machine learning capabilities would help them get ahead of specific problem sets, which will vary from combatant command to combatant command.? 
For instance, U.S. Southern Command might be focused on transnational criminal organizations, while U.S. European Command might be focusing on threats from Russia and U.S. Indo-Pacific Command on threats from China, he said.? 
A Saildrone Explorer unmanned surface vessel is being towed out to sea in the Arabian Gulf off Bahrain’s coast, Jan. 27, 2022. U.S. Naval Forces Central Command began operationally testing the USV as part of an initiative to integrate new unmanned systems and artificial intelligence into U.S. 5th Fleet operations.
Sherman also mentioned cybersecurity as it relates to securing data and algorithms.? 
"We talk a lot about zero trust," he said. "That assumes an adversary is already on our network. How do we micro-segment our network so as to prevent that adversary from moving laterally? And, we're going to leverage AI to help us get even better as we employ zero trust."? 
Sherman also said that AI will be important in satellite communications as well as command and control.? 
Martell said leveraging the relationship with industry is important. "It doesn't make any sense for us to build things that we shouldn't be building here if industry already has a solution."? 
Also, Martell mentioned that startups and innovative small industries should be sought out by DOD for their creative solutions.? 
Sherman said he agreed and added that DOD needs to work with small and medium industries to help them bolster their cybersecurity needs.??
中文原文: 国防部官员讨论了数字转型和人工智能在使战斗机保持战场优势方面的重要性，尽管中国和俄罗斯为军事目的开发了自己的人工智能。？6月8日，在国防部数字和人工智能研讨会上，国防部首席信息官约翰·B·谢尔曼（John B.Sherman）与国防部首席数字和人工智能官克雷格·马特尔（Craig Martell）举行了一次炉边聊天。？谢尔曼祝贺马爹利被任命担任这一新的领导职务。谢尔曼说，他给团队带来了一个有价值的行业视角，并指出马爹利才上任三天，就开始工作了。？？数字和人工智能主管使用缩写为CDAO，6月1日达到完全运营能力，负责领导和监督国防部在数据、分析和人工智能方面的战略发展和政策制定；在适当的国防部机构进程中打破数据和人工智能采用的障碍；并创建支持组件开发和部署数据、分析、AI和数字支持解决方案的赋能数字基础设施和服务。谢尔曼指出，CDAO的手中充满了现实世界的作战需求，包括乌克兰战争、商业分析、反无人驾驶航空系统和数据治理等各种各样的事情。？2021年10月20日，在亚利桑那州尤马试验场，人工智能集成中心的陆军参谋中士伊丽莎白·丹宁（Elise Denning）对一个无人驾驶航空系统进行维护，为融合项目做准备。在测试期间，士兵们正在试验使用UAS进行自主目标感知和人工智能的方法，帮助士兵在战场上看东西。马爹利说，他不仅会关注今天的战斗，还会关注五年或十年后的未来战斗。？“我们需要找到差距，找到我们可以利用价值的正确地方，然后这种价值将推动变革的良性循环，”马特尔说。“很多人认为国防部应该更像工业。有些是真的。但是国防部有很多事情不能更像工业。……我们需要找出如何保持国防部，但也要让它更有效率，更好地工作。”谢尔曼提到，他和马特尔的工作涉及与军方、国防信息系统局和战斗人员指挥官就他们所做的一切进行大量协调和沟通，如人工智能和数据加速器以及数字服务。他们是最终客户。？谢尔曼继续说，该团队不断思考什么样的人工智能和机器学习能力将帮助他们提前解决特定的问题集，这些问题集将因作战指挥而异。？他说，例如，美国南方司令部可能专注于跨国犯罪组织，而美国欧洲司令部可能专注于来自俄罗斯的威胁，美国印度-太平洋司令部专注于来自中国的威胁。？2022年1月27日，在巴林海岸的阿拉伯湾，一艘Saildrone Explorer无人水面舰艇被拖出大海。美国海军中央司令部开始对USV进行作战测试，作为将新的无人系统和人工智能融入美国第五舰队行动的举措的一部分。谢尔曼还提到了网络安全，因为它与保护数据和算法有关。？“我们经常谈论零信任，”他说。“这假设一个对手已经在我们的网络上。我们如何微分割我们的网络，以防止对手横向移动？而且，我们将利用人工智能来帮助我们变得更好，因为我们使用零信任。”？谢尔曼还说，人工智能在卫星通信以及指挥和控制方面都很重要。？马爹利说，利用与行业的关系很重要。“如果工业界已经有了解决方案，我们建造我们不应该在这里建造的东西是没有任何意义的。”？此外，马爹利提到，国防部应该寻找初创企业和创新型小行业的创造性解决方案。？谢尔曼说，他同意这一观点，并补充说，国防部需要与中小企业合作，帮助他们满足网络安全需求。？？

中文标题: 美国空军进行F-15E战斗机核武器系统评估
整编内容: 2021年8月14日，美空军空战司令部的F-15E战斗机在内利斯空军基地完成了核常能力兼备飞机的核武器系统评估项目（DCA NucWSEP）。该项目任务旨在对维修、机组人员和武器操作员等方面进行测试和评估，以保证空基核能力的可靠性。
整编机构: 航空工业信息中心
源标题: F-15Es take part in weapons evaluations, enhance readiness
原文:
Nov.22, 2021
F-15E Strike Eagles from Air Combat Command participated in Dual Capable Aircraft Nuclear Weapons System Evaluation Program at Nellis Air Force Base, earlier this fall.
In this iteration of DCA NucWSEP, aircrew and maintenance professionals flew and loaded B61-3 and B61-4 Joint Test Assemblies, known as JTAs, on F-15Es provided by the 391st Fighter Squadron, Mountain Home Air Force Base, Idaho. The JTAs were released at the Tonopah Test Range to support efforts to further test the F-15E’s inherent ability to deliver B61 series tactical nuclear weapons.
“A Nuclear Evaluation Mission tests and evaluates maintenance, aircrew, and weapons Airmen to provide assurance of nuclear capabilities from stockpile to delivery,” said Lt. Col. Douglas Kabel, ACC’s Strategic Deterrence and Nuclear Integration deputy director. “It improves our readiness by giving our warfighters the experience they would need to employ the F-15E and the B61 series weapons in a future conflict within a contested environment.”
As part of the “4+1” future fighter plan, the F-15E provides a complimentary tie from fourth-generation DCA platforms with fifth and sixth-generation fighters. This means that F-15Es continue to play a significant role as the Air Force refines the Combat Air Force, Force Generation Concept.
“CAFFORGEN will increase and sustain readiness for combat air forces,” said Gen. Mark Kelly, commander of ACC. “We have to generate high-performing combat teams before combat – and get them in place at the speed of relevance.”
F-15Es from units around ACC are preparing for the future fight by participating in exercises and operations that incorporate ACE concepts, which ensure forward-deployed forces are ready to protect and defend the United States and ensure readiness and availability to operate alongside allies and security partners.
The 366 FW at Mountain Home AFB, which sourced the F-15E’s used during the recent DCA NucWSEP, participated in Indo-Pacific Command’s Pacific Iron Dynamic Force Employment just weeks before the NucWSEP event.
ACE is the use of agile operations to generate resilient airpower in a contested environment and dynamic force employment is one way the Air Force provides ACE capability to combatant commanders on short notice for strategic effects. These employments are designed to enhance readiness for the high-end fight and provide Airmen who are agile in operational execution, strategic in deterrence, and more resilient in capability.
“As a dual-capable aircraft participating in ACE operations, we send a strong message to our allies and adversaries that our capabilities are credible, our options are numerous and we can respond to crisis in any corner of the world at a moment’s notice,” Kabel said. “These operations enable our joint team to provide extended deterrence to our allies in Europe and around the world in support of our national security strategy.”
中文原文: 2021年11月22日今年秋天早些时候，空战司令部的F-15E攻击鹰参加了内利斯空军基地的双能飞机核武器系统评估计划。在DCA NucWSEP的这次迭代中，空勤人员和维修专业人员在爱达荷州山地家园空军基地第391战斗机中队提供的F-15Es上飞行并装载了B61-3和B61-4联合测试组件，称为JTA。JTA在托诺帕试验靶场发布，以支持进一步测试F-15E运载B61系列战术核武器的固有能力的努力。ACC战略威慑和核一体化副主任道格拉斯·卡贝尔中校（Douglas Kabel）表示：“核评估任务测试和评估维护、机组人员和武器飞行员，以提供从储存到交付的核能力保证。”“它通过给我们的战士在未来有争议的环境中的冲突中使用F-15E和B61系列武器所需的经验，提高了我们的准备能力。”作为“4+1”未来战斗机计划的一部分，F-15E提供了第四代DCA平台与第五代和第六代战斗机的免费联系。这意味着F-15Es将继续在空军精炼空军作战、兵力生成概念时发挥重要作用。ACC指挥官马克·凯利将军说：“CAFFORGEN将提高和维持战斗空军的准备状态。”“我们必须在战斗前组建高性能的战斗小组--并以相关的速度让他们到位。”来自ACC周围单位的F-15正在通过参加纳入ACE概念的演习和行动为未来的战斗做准备，这些演习和行动确保前沿部署的部队准备好保护和保卫美国，并确保准备好和可与盟友和安全伙伴一起行动。山之家空军基地的366 FW是最近DCA NucWSEP期间使用的F-15E的来源，就在NucWSEP活动前几周，它参加了印度-太平洋司令部的太平洋钢铁动力部队的雇用。ACE是在有争议的环境中使用敏捷行动来产生弹性空中力量，动态兵力使用是空军在短时间内为作战指挥官提供ACE能力以获得战略效果的一种方式。这些用途旨在提高高端战斗的准备状态，并提供灵活的作战执行、战略威慑和更有弹性的能力的飞行员。卡贝尔说：“作为一架参与ACE行动的双能飞机，我们向我们的盟友和对手发出了一个强烈的信息，即我们的能力是可信的，我们的选择是众多的，我们可以在接到通知后立即应对世界任何角落的危机。”“这些行动使我们的联合团队能够向我们在欧洲和世界各地的盟友提供延伸威慑，以支持我们的国家安全战略。”

中文标题: 瑞士开发出铒掺杂光子集成放大器
整编内容: 近日，瑞士洛桑联邦理工学院研究人员开发出铒掺杂光子集成放大器(EDFAs)。该放大器可用于长距离光纤通信电缆和光纤激光器，为光纤中的光信号功率提供增益。贝尔实验室发现传统铒掺杂放大器(EDWAs)的增益和输出功率无法与基于光纤的放大器相匹配，同时无法与当代光子集成制造技术兼容。为此，研究人员开发出一种基于氮化硅(Si3N4)光子集成电路的毫米级尺寸的铒掺杂放大器，它能够产生超过145毫瓦的输出功率，并提供超过30 分贝的信号净增益，相当于在电信频带中对信号实现了超过1000倍的放大。该研究成果在光通信、激光雷达，以及大型量子网络的量子传感器和存储器等技术领域具有极大应用价值。
关键词: 掺铒放大器 光信号 光通信 氮化硅
整编机构: 国家工业信息安全发展研究中心
源标题: Photonic integrated erbium doped amplifiers reach commercial performance
原文:
Erbium-doped fiber amplifiers (EDFAs) are devices that can provide gain to the optical signal power in optical fibers. They are often used in long-distance communication fiber optic cables and fiber-based lasers. Invented in the 1980s, EDFAs have profoundly impacted our information society enabling signals to be routed across the Atlantic and replacing electrical repeaters.
What is interesting about erbium ions in optical communications is that they can amplify light in the 1.55 mm wavelength region, which is where silica-based optical fibers have the lowest transmission loss. The unique electronic intra-4-f shell structure of erbium—and rare-earth ions in general—enables long-lived excited states when doped inside host materials such as glass. This provides an ideal gain medium for simultaneous amplification of multiple information-carrying channels, with negligible cross-talk, high temperature stability and low noise.
Optical amplification is also used in virtually all laser applications, from fiber sensing and frequency metrology, to industrial applications including laser-machining and LiDAR. Today, optical amplifiers based on rare-earth ions have become the workhorse for optical frequency combs, which are used to create the world's most precise atomic clocks.
Achieving light amplification with rare-earth ions in photonic integrated circuit can transform integrated photonics. In the 1990s, Bell Laboratories was looking into erbium-doped waveguide amplifiers (EDWAs), but ultimately abandoned them because their gain and output power could not match fiber-based amplifiers, while their fabrication doesn't work with contemporary photonic integration manufacturing techniques.
Even with the recent rise of integrated photonics, renewed efforts on EDWAs have only been able to achieve less than 1 mW output power, which is not enough for many practical applications. The problem here has been high waveguide background loss, high cooperative upconversion—a gain-limiting factor at high erbium concentration, or the long-standing challenge in achieving meter-scale waveguide lengths in compact photonic chips.
Now, researchers at EPFL, led by Professor Tobias J. Kippenberg, have built an EDWA based on silicon nitride (Si3N4) photonic integrated circuits of a length up to half meter on a millimeter-scale footprint, generating a record output power of more than 145 mW and providing a small-signal net gain above 30 dB, which translates to over 1000-fold amplification in the telecommunication band in continuous operation. This performance matches the commercial, high-end EDFAs, as well as state-of-the-art heterogeneously integrated III-V semiconductor amplifiers in silicon photonics.
"We overcame the longstanding challenge by applying ion implantation—a wafer-scale process that benefits from very low cooperative upconversion even at a very high ion concentration—to the ultralow-loss silicon nitride integrated photonic circuits," says Dr. Yang Liu, a researcher in Kippenberg's lab, and the lead scientist for the study published in Science.
"This approach allows us to achieve low loss, high erbium concentration, and a large mode-ion overlap factor in compact waveguides with meter-scale lengths, which have previously remained unsolved for decades," says Zheru Qiu, a Ph.D. student and co-author of the study.
"Operating with high output power and high gain is not a mere academic achievement; in fact, it is crucial to the practical operation of any amplifier, as it implies that any input signals can reach the power levels that are sufficient for long-distance high-speed data transmission and shot-noise limited detection; it also signals that high-pulse-energy femtosecond-lasers on a chip can finally become possible using this approach," says Kippenberg.
The breakthrough signals a renaissance of rare-earth ions as viable gain media in integrated photonics, as applications of EDWAs are virtually unlimited, from optical communications and LiDAR for autonomous driving, to quantum sensing and memories for large quantum networks. It is expected to trigger follow-up studies that cover even more rare-earth ions, offering optical gain from the visible up to the mid-infrared part of the spectrum and even higher output power.
中文原文: 掺铒光纤放大器（EDFAs）是一种能够对光纤中的光信号功率提供增益的器件。它们常用于远距离通信光缆和光纤激光器。EDFAs发明于20世纪80年代，它深刻地影响了我们的信息社会，使信号能够穿越大西洋传输，并取代了电子中继器。铒离子在光通信中的有趣之处在于，它们可以放大1.55mm波长范围内的光，这是硅基光纤传输损耗最低的地方。铒离子和一般稀土离子独特的intra-4-f电子壳层结构使得在玻璃等主体材料中掺杂时能产生长寿命的激发态。这为同时放大多个信息承载信道提供了理想的增益介质，具有可忽略的串扰、高温稳定性和低噪声。从光纤传感和频率测量到工业应用，包括激光加工和激光雷达，光放大也被用于几乎所有的激光应用。今天，基于稀土离子的光放大器已经成为用于制造世界上最精确的原子钟的光频梳的主力。在光子集成电路中利用稀土离子实现光放大，可以改造集成光子学。20世纪90年代，贝尔实验室正在研究掺铒波导放大器(EDWAs)，但最终放弃了它们，因为它们的增益和输出功率无法与基于光纤的放大器相匹配，而它们的制造不适合当代光子集成制造技术。即使最近集成光子学的兴起，对EDWAs的新努力也只能实现小于1 mW的输出功率，这对于许多实际应用来说是不够的。这里的问题是高波导背景损耗、高合作上转换--高铒浓度下的增益限制因素，或者是在紧凑型光子芯片中实现米级波导长度的长期挑战。现在，由Tobias J.Kippenberg教授领导的EPFL的研究人员已经基于氮化硅(Si3N4)光子集成电路构建了一个EDWA，其长度可达半米，占地毫米级，产生了超过145毫瓦的创纪录输出功率，并提供了超过30分贝的小信号净增益，这相当于在电信频段连续运行时的1000倍以上的放大。这种性能与商用高端EDFA以及硅光子学中最先进的异质集成III-V半导体放大器相匹配。Kippenberg实验室的研究人员、发表在《科学》杂志上的这项研究的首席科学家杨柳博士说：“我们通过将离子注入应用到超低损耗氮化硅集成光子电路中，克服了长期的挑战--一种晶片规模的过程，即使在非常高的离子浓度下，也可以从非常低的合作上转换中受益。”“这种方法使我们能够在米级长度的紧凑型波导中实现低损耗、高铒浓度和大模离子重叠系数，这些问题以前几十年来一直没有解决，”该研究的合著者、博士生Zheru Qu说。“以高输出功率和高增益工作不仅仅是学术成就；事实上，它对任何放大器的实际操作都至关重要，因为它意味着任何输入信号都可以达到足以进行长距离高速数据传输和散粒噪声有限检测的功率水平；它还表明，使用这种方法，芯片上的高脉冲能量飞秒激光最终可能成为可能，”Kippenberg说。这一突破标志着稀土离子作为集成光子学中可行的增益介质的复兴，因为EDWAs的应用实际上是无限的，从用于自动驾驶的光通信和激光雷达，到用于大型量子网络的量子传感和存储器。它有望引发后续研究，涵盖更多的稀土离子，提供从可见光到中红外光谱的光学增益，以及更高的输出功率。
